    Welcome to ITA's Developer Portal

    Data Services Platform

    Through ITA's Developer Portal, the International Trade Administration (ITA) gives software developers documentation and instructions for accessing ITAâ€™s Data Services Platform. In turn, the Data Services Platform provides direct access to authoritative information on U.S. exporting and international trade intended specifically for public use and dissemination.

    ITA has built the platform to be the central source for exporting data important to small and medium sized U.S. businesses. We encourage software developers to integrate this data into their applications and mash-ups to help U.S. small business owners expand their business overseas while creating jobs at home.

    Please review the list of Available APIs in our navigation menu. We will continue to add APIs as they become available.

    What Can You Find Here?


      Guidance

      If you are not a developer get guidance on integrating ITA's data into your Web site or mobile app.


      App Gallery

      Get ideas from other organizations that have used ITA's data in their Web sites and mobile apps.


      Change Log

      Find out about the latest updates to make sure you're getting the most out of the APIs.

    News

    Have you used ITA's APIs to create a cool app or Web page? Let us know.

    May 4, 2015

    Version 2 of ITA's Data Services Platform Released.

    March 31, 2015

    You can now use HTTPS as well as HTTP for your API calls.

    January 13, 2015

    Please give us feedback about the APIs and the documentation by filling out our survey on Survey Monkey.

    December 12, 2014

USA.gov | FOIA | Privacy Policy | Disclaimer | Information Quality Guidelines

The International Trade Administration, U.S. Department of Commerce, manages this global trade site to provide access to ITA information on promoting trade and investment, strengthening the competitiveness of U.S. industry, and ensuring fair trade and compliance with trade laws and agreements. External links to other Internet sites should not be construed as an endorsement of the views or privacy policies contained therein.
